alert.note: Alert for Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 4:30PM EDT until July 25 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Burlington, Camden, and Gloucester. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. An additional inch is possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Evesham, Deptford, Voorhees, West Deptford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Pitman, Berlin, Paulsboro, and Magnolia. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 2 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 12 and 26...and near mile marker 31. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 40 and 44. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
